website_summaries.verdict: The perfect choice if you're looking for a sleek yet durable flash drive that easily attaches to any key chain.
pros: Drive is quite thin, not much bigger than USB port itself
Large key-ring hole on the end  is a welcomed design aspect
Drive runs smoothly and is recognized instantly on any computer
Transferring larger files isn't an issue
For the low price, you could easily buy a different USB for every set of keys you have
cons: There is no LED indicator when SE9 plugged in

customer_reviews.title: these are only USB sticks that give us problems.
customer_reviews.text: as we manage 100s (1000s maybe?) of servers, we are constantly creating bootable USB sticks (either as a hypervisior or OS boot device, or more often as installation media). And these various Kingston DataTravlers are amoung the very few that constantly give us issues. Constantly! they are enticing as they are low price and dont take up more than 1 USB slot when inserted, but dont fall for it. And if they are failing at our types of use-case, they will fail your use-case as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: By far the best USB drive I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.text: The size, construction and shape is just about perfect. Put it on your key ring and let it go about in your pocket all day without any problems. I’ve been using mine for 4+ years now without any problems. The case barely has any scrapes or scuffs on it. Still works. A little on the slow side compared to newer specifications, but it still does exactly what I need it to do and keeps on going.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: FAILED TO WORK TOO MANY TIMES!!!
customer_reviews.text: I hate to write negative reviews. I'm always trying to be focused on good things in general, but I swear to God, it's been a complete torture dealing with Kingston Data Traveler. After using it once or twice, it does not react at all. None of my computers (I have 4 computers) or my friend's computers recognize this 16 GB Kingston thumbdrive. Excuse me, but I HATE IT, because IT FAILED TO WORK TOO MANY TIMES!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bibster

customer_reviews.title: #1 LOST. #2 LOST. #3 I'LL LOSE IT.
customer_reviews.text: 5-Stars on everything but a 4 star overall rating? Why? IT'S TOO DARN SMALL I'VE LOST 2 OF THE 3 ORDERED And the only reason I haven't lost the third one is because it's still in the package. Do they work? YES Are they small? FK YES Can you find them when you lose them? I think the vacuum found one. Not sure. Could have been a coin. But it gave me a fright when the vacuum sounded like something from a horror movie last week. I'm not sure if YOU will find it, but if you dip it in peanut butter, your dog will.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky

customer_reviews.title: Great little thumb drive
customer_reviews.text: I've used this design from Kensington for years, this one is replacing one that was lost during a move. I'm going to use this one for the same purpose: fresh install of windows on new computers to get rid of manufacturer bloatware. There are several videos on YouTube on how to do this, so I won't bore you with the details. I've used these in larger sizes to take movies on airplanes, make playlists for my car stereo, and other normal thumb drive uses, etc. The design works for me because it's easy to carry, can be put on a keychain, and the utilitarian shape allows for east labeling. Great product from a reliable company for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Only 14GB - Not 15GB, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these to make recovery drives for computers. They are nice and compact, but one of the three only had 14GB of useable space. The other two were 16GB. When attempting to return the one with less storage capacity than advertised, I was told that the item doesn't qualify for a return, even though Amazon's return policy says defective electronics can be returned w/in 30 days of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: timwoo

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a jump drive
customer_reviews.text: I work as a school tech so I like to have a flash drive on my key chain with handy documents, but also a separate jump drive to start computers easily when needed. My main flash drive was already kind of bulky on my keychain so I wanted something sleek and small for the jump drive. Although it's kind of a waste of gb to use it as a jump drive, I just couldn't pass up the portability of it. I'm very happy that I got it, and would recommend this for people who want an unassuming USB stick if they aren't planning on storing a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Couch

customer_reviews.title: worth exceeds cost bar far
customer_reviews.text: what i wanted super small fits on keychain some say comes unglued one even said all the do is glue them in for shame how else should it attach? well look at reviews all production is not perfect ill take my chances all i use mine for is transfer documents so speed is either intant or irrelevant would i use it for sensitive data? some cried cause the lost top secret stuff well maybe you shouldn't use 6 dollar thumb drive for that then . sorry just sick of people being unreasonable about low cost items. works great for my needs and ill trust i'm one of the 92% completely satisfied and wont experience failure.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Compact and well made, but no cap
customer_reviews.text: It seems uncommon these days to protect the inside of the male USB type A plug from dirt and other damage, so I guess it's “acceptable” that this device doesn't have protection either. I knew that when I bought it, but I still want to mention it is something that I would like to have, and that's why I only give it four stars for portability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality, reliable storage.
customer_reviews.text: Solid product. I've owned many of these Kingston Travelers usb 2.0 from 4gb up to 32gb. Never had one fail yet, over at least 7 year period of routine use for backup and transporting linux operating systems and work files. Never had any corrupted files, or data loss. Very satisfied. Just to be clear though, because I've seen where reviews on Amazon show under multiple, completely different products from the same manufacturer, I've never used any of the usb 3 models from Kingston. I can't speak to their reliability, and the reviews seem to indicate a pattern of lower satisfaction rating with those faster models.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenheart1992

customer_reviews.title: Most popular USB thumb drive around here
customer_reviews.text: Probably due cost, these thumb drives are the most popular at my office. We work in an international team, with people from Asia, Europe, North and South America. We have around so many of these drives (yes, these very ones) that it becomes an issue. In any case, the USB 2.0 connection is probably the worst thing on these drives. We are in 2019, USB 3.1 is the very least. But man, they are so economical. On top of that, the drives are sturdy, well made, and durables. A total winner.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan G

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but quite slow write speed,cap would be nice too!
customer_reviews.text: I have on old Kingston flash drive that is USB 2.0 and it writes about 2 to three times faster than this one does! For the price and storage space this drive is a solid choice with a decent outside build however. It should have come with a cap though so the inner piece has no chance of falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Ajani Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Well Made, Removable USB Storage
customer_reviews.text: The only thing missing on these inexpensive "USB Thumb drives" are an activity light. While knit pickings, how about knurling the area surrounding the "keyhole". My aging, stuff fingers find the beautiful, smooth finish on these gadgets difficult to pull out of the computer's USB Type A socket. Other than that, there is nothing wrong with these storage devices. In most cases they do not even need to be formatted (it is a good idea to do so anyway.)
customer_reviews.author: SheemOn Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Not very fast, but love the small size on my keychain. Great for storing data files.
customer_reviews.text: This little gem has an enormous capacity for the price. The size and shape is perfect to carry with my keys. In the past I have carried thumb drives in my pocket, but they eventually fall out and are lost. This puppy will stay put when connected to my keys. Don’t expect blazing read/write speeds, but it is still respectable. It seems to be very durable, being metal. Because it is narrow, I cannot imagine there is a computer that it wouldn’t fit. It has no cap, and doesn’t need one. Just plug/play. It is formatted as FAT32,which is a format that is pretty much compatible with any computer, but you can re-format it any way you wish.
customer_reviews.author: Fdavet

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick copies, homework files, and general usage
customer_reviews.text: The Kingston Digital Data Traveler SE9 is the perfect USB Flash Drive for your everyday student uses (quick Excel/word/ etc copies), creating HTML/CSS files, copying code files, drivers for quick IT tasks... etc They are not the fastest flash drives. Don't expect to get super awesome benchmarks for the drives. They are built well, cheap to buy many at once (if lost by kids), great for 6th - 8th / High School / General College, and good for quick copies here and there. They are decent for IT Tools as well. If the above fits your scenario, don't hesitate to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bluevoodu

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: this worked for about a month, then crapped out. I was using it relatively lightly - I was utilizing ~3 of the ~32gigs and it never left the desk. While in use, the drive suddenly ejected itself and would not be recognized by my computer. Annoying, I thought - but my computer is a little old. So, I took it to work to have it reformatted/initialized. It wouldn't be recognized on that computer either. Emergency recovery software cannot pull anything from it, running first aid on it does nothing, etc. I'm kind of lucky I didn't have anything really crucial on it, but I wish I hadn't bought it at all after all this time wasted and non-functional tech.
customer_reviews.author: EspressoFox

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see the small profile. At first I didn't think it was going to fit in the port. I'm a tech that likes to carry around a USB drive around with important programs. It didn't feel like I added much to my keychain and didn't make me feel like I was carrying anything extra when I had my keys in my pocket. The metal is a little slippery if you don't put it on a keychain or a hook. You might lose it if you just sit it around somewhere so it always needs to be attached to something. But for my use, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Litzsey

customer_reviews.title: S.....l.........o..........w............
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 of these to send some large data sets. Write speed was typically just below 4 Mbps with some smaller files getting up around 8-9 Mbps. Around 20 GB of data was taking a minimum 25-30 min, I can quite literally upload it to the internet much faster. Wishing my client could accept the high speed Micro SD that I usually keep on hand! Will try something else. It is a sleek little drive that looks nice and would be great on a key chain, but for my application its near useless.
customer_reviews.author: rin-amazon-aic

customer_reviews.title: It's really small, reliable, but not that fast
customer_reviews.text: I am please with this DataTraveler, this is my third unit. What I love the most is the pocket size and the clear simple design. Very reliable I have use this unit for 3-4 year without the first failure. The only thing that avoid the fifth star, is the write/read speeds, I got 1-3Mbps write and 9-12MBps read, they are not terrible, but if you use it to write/read thousand of tiny files you will have the lower transfer rates, in that case you might look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Osiricat

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: feels like I can't really say much about it, much like you can't say much about a notebook unless it doesn't work properly. This one works for me. I've had it for 4 years, kept it in utterly atrocious conditions, buried under tons of stuff, caked in dust, slammed and mashed into many USB holes, with a roughly 13% chance of getting it into a USB hole the first time. it hasn't had any failures or problems and it hasn't slowed or broken apart. only complaint would be design-related; namely it's an ugly stainless steel finish and has nothing to cover the bottom end
customer_reviews.author: Aiex Halo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly Fragile
customer_reviews.text: This item was small and neat, worked perfectly, and appeared to be very rugged. I attached it to my key ring, which lives in my trouser pocket. Imagine my surprise, when less than three weeks later I observed that the metal shell had cracked right along one edge, and one flat side was deformed inwards. Just from jangling around in my pocket with my keys! I straightened the bent side with a small pair of pliers, and the unit still functions, but it is nowhere near as robust as I'd hoped, and for this it gets a low score.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JUST DIED
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 3 stars because it died! No warning, just stopped working! To be fair while this worked, I loved it! That said, I plugged it into my computer on Wednesday and it worked fine. I plugged it in on Friday and nothing! It won't mount to ANY computer so I know it isn't my computer. I have used it about 1 year and I really expected it to last MUCH longer! Very disappointed, especially since it comes highly rated.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice, compact, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Ten years ago, a 32 GB drive in this form factor would have been phenomenal. Today, 32 GB isn't all that much. But for the small price, mine was great for transferring a diagnostic program (Hirens) onto one drive, and an image of Windows 10 on another. The large hole on the drive makes it easy to mount on a keyring, or hang on a hook. The drive works flawlessly. It also looks good. If you don't need USB3, or more storage capacity, for the price, it's hard to go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Northridge Mark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome small metal USB drives
customer_reviews.text: These are small form metal USBs. I attached a picture for size comparison against a Sandisk Cruzer glide. I have been using them for a while, they transfer files well at a decent speed. My only issue is their hard to label. I clean the exterior and tried permanent markers and stickers. After a few days the label rubs off or the sticker comes off. I plan on buying more because I like the build quality.
customer_reviews.author: K Diggy

customer_reviews.title: Watch out!!!! It’s old technology, very slow!
customer_reviews.text: Works, is solid build quality, but I didn’t realize they were usb 2.0 and not 3.0/3.1 which has been the new standard for years now. The end result was is taking about 1 hour to load files on, and I had to make 10 copies for friends... not the best use of a weekend. If they were the newer/current standard it probably would have taken about 15-20 minutes instead of 60.
customer_reviews.author: William Elixir

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Portable, Large Capacity Storage, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: As a returning customer trusting Kingston brand, this purchase did not disappoint me at all, instead I am VERY IMPRESSED and SATISFIED with its storage capacity, speed, and size. I added a bright ribbon to the USB flash drive in case if I drop it, I could easily spot it on the dark floor. I ordered it on Amazon for an affordable price, and received it the next day through Prime. Buy it! I will definitely buy more, oh happy me!
customer_reviews.author: LilButterflyVani

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Professional Drives
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several sizes of these flash drives on several different occasions. I have had no failures in the dozen or so drives that I have used to share data between my machines or between myself and colleagues. The professional, smart look of the small, brushed stainless drive is very impressive when using to share with others. Fits nicely on a key ring, lanyard, carabiner, string, or just about anything. People love to be gifted these little drives along with the data files! Update: I just recently left one of these in my trouser pocket and it went through the wash and dryer. Works perfect, still!
customer_reviews.author: A. Posey

customer_reviews.title: Adequately Functional; Small Size
customer_reviews.text: It is surprisingly small in size, physically; not blistering fast (USB 2.0, NOT 3.0). Perfectly fine for most jobs but could be frustrating and possibly deadly, if you're in a hurry to download Top Secret, spy plane specs before Navy SEALs burst through the door with guns blazing. Although it is small enough to swallow in a last-ditch effort to hide incriminating evidence.
customer_reviews.author: Blacksatin

customer_reviews.title: NO BRAINER - Get this one!
customer_reviews.text: FAR exceeded my expectations! I need a small flash drive to occasionally send to photography customers. Each of these drives comes in a small rigid glossy white paper envelope and is contained within that in a perfectly-sized, easily opened (and reusable) clear plastic clamshell. The metal (!) drive itself is surprising small and perfectly functional for both Macs and PC's (just format exFAT or FAT32). This is wonderful in every way.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: No brainer 5 star product.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this flash drive for several years now (bought it from amazon). It has performed flawlessly. Couldn't be happier, and have given a few to some coworkers and friends whom also love these things. No frills, dependable, tough flash drives that are durable enough to live on your everyday keys even for field service techs like me. The only complaint I have is that it can take a second to determine top and bottom since there is so little writing on the drive to determine orientation. I actually engraved mine with both my initials, and the word 'top' on one side to make orientation easier. 5 stars is a no brainer on this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Akajones

customer_reviews.title: repeat
customer_reviews.text: this is the third of these heavy duty little drives that I have purchased. they dangle from every key ring in my collection and not one has ever failed despite being buried, tugged, swung, banged and chucked about. I am a mac user and these drives are the bomb. the fact that I need an adapter now to use .them on my macbook pro is abombidible, but that is Mac's fault.
customer_reviews.author: richard lovrich

customer_reviews.title: They were awesome and really convenient
customer_reviews.text: Bought these awhile ago. Both don't work now - I had them on my keyring and they stopped reading in my computer after about 6 months. These are not made to handle any kind of abuse - keep them seperate from your keys if you plan on using them. I DJ and prepare my tracks via Rekordbox - it was a real pain in the butt one night when one of them didn't load (I always prep two exact copies of the USB stick in case the link on the CDJs doesn't work). Bought a pair from a different brand the next day. While they worked? They were awesome and really convenient
customer_reviews.author: Big C

customer_reviews.title: It does its job.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for that ridiculously large windows update. My notebook just didn't have enough disk space for the update, so I bought this and downloaded the update on it as a last resort. You can find a step-by-step guide on how to do this online if you have my problem. It did it's job perfectly and now has a forever home with me. I can use my notebook again, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kristle

customer_reviews.title: A $1 or so more in cost than the 'no-name' brand but worth it for these FAST data transfers
customer_reviews.text: I needed memory for backup and file transport. Previously purchased some 'no-name' brand pack of five sticks and found them to be full memory but SLOW to the point that they couldnot be used. The 'no-name' brand transffered data at roughly 27Kb/sec! It would take hours to fill a stick at that rate and the access time was worse. I then decided to pay roughly $1 more (each) for five of these Kingston thumbdrives. They flash on for immediate access, transfer data in burst at more than 20Meg/sec and constant transfer at 4Meg/sec.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Zavecz

customer_reviews.title: Slow File Access
customer_reviews.text: I previously had this drive in the 8 GB and was really happy with it. I'm a college professor and had it on my office keys for three or so years to bring my lectures with me to the various classrooms. That drive got full so I got the 32 GB replacement. It has been really slow. It took a long time to transfer files from the 8GB drive to the 32 and whenever I open files on the 32 GB drive it is really slow. I have no idea why the larger drive is running so much slower, but it is rather disappointing. I never experienced the memory part falling out of the casing as others have reported.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Kanak

customer_reviews.title: Metal loop will not break
customer_reviews.text: I had a plastic USB drive that I carried around but the loop broke so I couldn't keep it on my key ring anymore. This one has not broken after years of use and is always where I expect it to be. Storage could be higher, but for the price and for how I'm using it, mainly documents that I don't want to put in the cloud but need to take with me, it has been plenty of space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but VERY SLOWWW
customer_reviews.text: Using it as a recovery USB stick for Win10. That drive is slow, but I don't really care and hope I never have to use it. I'm only hoping that it's reliable. Read 35.4 MB/s Write 4.2 MB/s 4K Read 5.5 MB/s 4K Write 0.2 MB/s
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Works fine to install ESXi, fits into onboard headers
customer_reviews.text: I really like that many manufacturers are moving to horizontal USB headers. Dell used vertical USB internal headers for a bit, which was always cumbersome - some devices would work well in a 1U server. Others, however, would not. These sticks fit nicely into the horizontal headers now common on the R-series devices. They install ESXi without any issue, and I can keep spares on-site in the event of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D. Crompton

customer_reviews.title: L o v e.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 16gb some time a few years ago I can't tell you how many times I've dropped in water, showered, or accidentally washed the damn thing. It's still the same as when I bought it, I've always loved Kingston. My first flash was a 4gb from forever ago, and I swear that thing never ran out no matter how much stuff I put on it. I had it for years before it unexpectedly disappeared. Which by the way survived accidental washes.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and snug fit
customer_reviews.text: Unusually snug fit for a USB stick can be a great feature for a laptop that travels. It might be a little too snug for something you insert and remove often but only because there is not much to grab on to (for those of us with big hands). I do like having a metal case that feels SUPER solid instead of a plastic case.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bienek

customer_reviews.title: Great body; but the guts don't stay put
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after seeing one that a collegue had bought for reimaging computers at work. I really liked the solid shell and apparent strength of the aluminum. I kept it on my keychain and sneaker-netted around the office with it. And one day I needed to move a file for a presentation, inserted the shell, and... No USB. Apparently the USB chip is not attached inside and can just slip out. Great idea--horrible implementation. I'm sure someone out there has my documents and data now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This product was a tad smaller than I expected. I guess I just didn't consider how much narrower it would be than a typical thumb drive. And I love it! This just gives me an excuse to buy 1 or 2 more and put the flash drives on their own keychains so I can tell them apart. The product appears incredibly sturdy. The value is excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Very Reliable For Boot Media
customer_reviews.text: Normally I use only USB 3 or 3.1 flash drives for portable storage. I bought these to use as Linux install media and for bootable PE tools. For this purpose USB 2 is much more reliable than USB 3. I have yet to find a PC that is capable of booting from USB that will not boot reliably from these flash drives. At this price I can afford several.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Used it to Restore Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I had a Chromebook that I hacked for emulation, but at the end of all I decided I liked using it as a Chromebook more. For some reason, my Chromebook and the restoration process did not want to recognize SanDisk memory devices. So I ordered this inexpensive Kingston. It did the job. Now I keep a bootable version of Ubuntu on the USB and I can boot any computer into Linux with it. It's tiny so it may be easy to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Edward B Loring

customer_reviews.title: Been using it since college, and it's still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I love how simple this flash drive is. I've gone through tons of flash drives through college, mainly ones that broke for one reason or another, but this specific flash drive has really just been the most reliable, and I adore it. It's small, but I can easily clip it onto a keyring if need be, and it's very portable!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: The perfect flash drive.
customer_reviews.text: Every single flash drive in the world has something wrong with it. The cap isn't attached and gets lost. The drive slides out and locks, but always seems to unlock when pushing it into a USB port. The housing is too wide to use adjacent USB ports. The drive is so tiny it's easily lost. It's just plastic. And ugly. Except this one. This one is perfect. Sleek, narrow, simple. Aesthetically pleasing yet perfectly functional. I keep a small cord on mine to attach it to a keychain. I will never buy a different form factor of USB drive as long as I live.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F.

customer_reviews.title: It's USB 2.0, not 3.0
customer_reviews.text: Five stars because it's a USB key that works and is small without a stupid cap and with a useful built in key. But be aware that it's five bucks because it's last decade technology. I missed that and was sad when it took forever (like, some number of minutes) to transfer a bunch of files. It works, but it's slow.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Nice finish, durable, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I give this 32GB flash drive 5 stars cause it fits the bill for these reasons: 1: easy to insert in USB port, a lot of people overlook this annoyance when purchasing a USB drive. I hate the ones that have the slider to insert it into a computer. If you don't hold the slider in place, it's impossible to insert. This type, is easy plug-n-play. 2: Transport- I have mine on my key chain with my vehicle keys. And finally, the Kingston name brand has always lasted for me. You have it all with this package, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: born1976

customer_reviews.title: Hard to insert into and remove from port.
customer_reviews.text: This is small which is great, but it took some force to insert into USB port and even more to remove it after use. This will probably change with use (I hope). But other than that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Just thinking

customer_reviews.title: Kingston has always worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I liked their rotating-cap design better, but this is okay. Some people have said that the capless ones break, but I don't carry mine on a keychain anyway, so it doesn't get banged around. Kingston has always worked for me. This is the older model, so it's cheaper but not as fast as the new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Clothes Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Low Price and Good Performance
customer_reviews.text: I tested some USB drives and this Kingston Digital DataTraveler SE9 16GB USB 2.0 DTSE9H/16GBZ had the best measurements of the 2.0 drives I tested. I got this from Amazon for under $5, so it was a steal. The body is nice because it's a one-piece aluminum shell that is guaranteed to fit any standard USB port, since there is nothing to block its insertion into restricted ports. It has a nice large keyring hole so it doesn't get bound up.
customer_reviews.author: TE5LA

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have one or something similar than I suggest you get one. You can download your personal items on your computer. Clouds are nice but who knows how private they really are. If you have your most important items on this and your computer gets a virus or crashes you have things you need saved. You can then wipe everything off your computer and start again. If you are like me you may need someone to do this for you. I have my son, who is my personal tech and knows more than those people that are paid to do this kind of thing.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these
customer_reviews.text: I love these, because you don't have to hold anything down to push it in. Also these are nice and small. I have several, and they are my favorite type of thumb drive. I have not had an issue with any that I have purchased. They work great for me. I think I have ordered 3 times for various types of storage.
customer_reviews.author: djss55

customer_reviews.title: quite a nice little drive
customer_reviews.text: recognized by my new computer's BIOS as well as the BIOS of my 10 year old server. I've used it to move files as well as flashing a few .iso files for booting. It's very compact and the metal casing is sturdy. Fits well on my keyring. I'm using it now as as persistent Knoppix install to boot from to make better use of the relatively ancient pentium 2 machines at work.
customer_reviews.author: Lorash

customer_reviews.title: A Piece of Metal, But Not a USB Drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have available when I needed it. Today I needed it, but now I regret having purchased it. Kingston is usually a very reliable brand. In this case, it wasn't. Neither of my computers recognize it. Unfortunately, my 30 return window has long since passed, so I'm stuck with it. So, in the end, it is a nice looking, tiny, piece of all but useless piece of metal. I can probably use it to scrape the mud or dog s*** off my shoes, but as a portable USB Flash drive it's worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Robb & Sharron

customer_reviews.title: SAVED ME
customer_reviews.text: Had to get this to put files from my computer and my phone to the flash due to storage issues and it has been a life changer. If you're running low on storage for your phone get an adapter to plug a flash drive into your phone and put all those files from your phone onto the flash. I work a lot with adobe illustrator and have large JPG files that were taking up a huge amount of storage on my phone and this flash SAVED ME - way cheaper and a micro SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Norris

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!  BROKE IN PIECES AND STUCK IN USB PORT OF COMPUTER
customer_reviews.text: After about a couple of months of minimal use, the thumb drive broke in pieces and is now stuck in the usb port of my computer. Wow, this is now a major problem. Will not be buying this unreliable product again!
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Only 28.8GB
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of these. Not too wide, doesn't crowd the USB ports. I have the 32GB which a little slower than my 8GB, but both are 2.0. Capacity is only 28.8GB. Why are they allowed to call it 32GB? Are we so used to lying it doesn't matter anymore. Is this "alternative math". Why not call it 50GB? You have to check everything these days. Deception is the norm. Would have given 4 stars without the lie.
customer_reviews.author: Kevino

customer_reviews.title: Good but still need to test it more
customer_reviews.text: Use for everyday, good product. Decent durability. Haven't dropped it in water so don't know of it is waterproof. Overall works with almost any computer although I have found that it sometimes doesn't register on certain devices, although it may be the device. Good price point for the amount of storage you get.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E.

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a flash dtive to boot from USB to various operating systems. Such as windows, Linux, and Apple. macOS. The stick is extremely reliable. It boots from almost any hardware and is always recognized. Mostly, I use these to recover user information from on unbootable hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: eth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing flash drive
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive is super durable and has lasted me almost 4 years of continual usage. I have this attached to my keychain and as a computer tech I use it often....almost daily. The transfer speeds are great (Not as good as 3.0 drives but also doesnt cost as much). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: 10% failure rate?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 20 of these. Two were dead on arrival. I know, I need to initiate a return, but I am traveling and it will have to wait. I was going to complain about the speed, but I just noticed now that they are listed as USB 2.0. Why do people still sell these things? My mistake, I didn't notice that in the description. I ordered junk and I got junk. I was warned, so we'll give it 3 stars for the dead drives I got.
customer_reviews.author: D Higby

customer_reviews.title: Works with unraid, metal shell keeps cool and protects
customer_reviews.text: This is working great with my unraid server. It was recommended because it's Shell is made of metal which keeps it from overheating. This should extend a life of this stick since heat is a killer of these devices. I will create your follow up review if I have any issues later on
customer_reviews.author: Maverick the engineer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Well what are the odds but looks like I received a defective thumb drive right out of the package. I bought as a back to school gift and was immediately handed back because it was not recognizing by any of the 4 computers we tried. I went to start a return on Amazon but shows item was shipped June 23, 2016 and return window closed July 24, 2016? No warranty help? All I would like is a working drive.
customer_reviews.author: Soundtouch

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with our Toyota RAV-4 sound system
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing our 2018 Rav-4 I spent 2-3 weeks trying to make the USB audio feature work. Frustrating! We didn't know if the problem was with the various USBs we were trying to use, or the USBs themselves. Ordered this, copied music from the PC to it, and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: ECS66

customer_reviews.title: Good But Slow
customer_reviews.text: Boy, does it take forever to copy stuff onto this thing! Much slower than my SanDisks. Don't know why. I do like the style, though. The hole is nice and big (not like those tiny SanDisk ones that you spend hours trying to fish something through), and there is no slider to break, or to retract itself when you're trying to push it in. Bottom Line: Buy it for when you're not copying large amounts.
customer_reviews.author: H. C.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.text: The Kingston Digital DataTraveler SE9 USB drive is a fantastic product. It's one rugged piece with no moving parts, and the one that I've carried on my keychain for several years continues to work flawlessly. The metal case is sized perfectly to fit into a USB slot, so there's no need for a plug that extends out from the body of the drive. The keychain loop is large enough to fit any style of keychain or keyring, and the fact that it's part of the case itself makes it very secure -- the only way you can lose this thing is to lose whatever it's attached to.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these drives to backup my laptop due having some issues with it. They are small in size but big in capacity. They worked right out of the package, no formatting needed. I was able to backup the import files that I didn't want to lose and fix my ailing computer.
customer_reviews.author: Feuryus Tees

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I used my new Stud Finder in a professional setting once. It worked as advertised. I was at a clients home and didn't dare make a mistake on finding dead-center of the wall studs for install of new TV mounting. I now have great confidence on all my TV installs. My old finder quit, but it was very old. Technology has come a long way since I bought my first finder. This new finder even locates and warns you if it finds electrical wires near where one is searching for studs. Now, off to install someones TV. All in all very pleased with this purchase. Easy to use, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device but buyer beware about actual space available for use.
customer_reviews.text: The device itself is excellent. Being that it is USB 2 copying took a while but I expected that. What got me was for 32GB the actual space available is 28.2GB a loss of 11.875%. I understand that SOME of this is because of "hardware math" calculations but even so the loss is a tad high. All this being said I would definitely purchase this again AFTER about a month of use just to make sure the thing holds up well to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kersi Von Zerububbel

customer_reviews.title: Small but  solid and mobile
customer_reviews.text: Its smaller than I thought it would be but its pretty cool. Im happy with it so far. I downloaded a file right away and will be giving it to my client so I wont be able to say anything as far as an issues down the road. It is very sturdy also. At this point I am very happy and plan to buy more. I am in Real Estate and for the price these are great to download files and give to clients. Great price and product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable little drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive is super durable. I normally get a little antsy about the plastic thumb drives but I still buy those because I do like that they are a bit larger and more colorful so they are less likely to get lost in my bags. I keep this attached to my keychain and I am not gentle with my keys. It has survived a lot of abuse and has come in handy many times. I don't keep anything important on it, but rather use it to transfer files or as a secondary backup option to keep my hard drive clear. It is small enough that I don't even notice it on my keychain while I'm carrying my keys around.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: It gets 4 stars just for working. As a ...
customer_reviews.text: It gets 4 stars just for working. As a USB drive it does everything I could ask. It stores and retrieves bits. The thing that surprised me was the size. The pictures don't do it justice. The thing would fit inside a USB slot if it were a little deeper. Look at the plug that sticks out of a USB device, That's the size of the entire drive. It's one piece of smooth metal. One side is stamped with Kingston and the size is on the other. Both completely understated. Lovely thing. I got 8 and 16 GB models and the only difference is the amount of storage, and in the right light the size etched on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Peter from Doylestown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I used this to load a bunch of Science Olympiad information and documents for a Freshman student to use. Because of it's small physical size I had her put it on her keychain so it wouldn't get lost. The design is really nice and the opening is plenty big for a keychain ring. Great value for the amount of space and reliability from the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Y

customer_reviews.title: Good design, but slow
customer_reviews.text: My requirements for a USB flash drive are simple: - capless design - metal, not plastic enclosure - reasonably fast This drive meets the first 2, and the one-piece design without any moving parts is probably going to be more reliable long-term than slider type designs. Unfortunately, it is quite slow - I can only manage about 4MBps read or write. I am only getting these to send large collections of photos or the like by mail, so it doesn't matter too much, but it is much too slow for real-world use, like copying a bunch of files quickly from my work PC (where I have a fast Internet connection) just before preparing to leave.
customer_reviews.author: Fazal Majid

customer_reviews.title: Too slow for me, but good for the $
customer_reviews.text: I really like the slim design and look overall. The problem is speed, but you get what you pay for. I forget the write speed but it was <4 M/sec. I bought several so they'll serve to share data with friends, which as most know you never get the drive back.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: huge storage
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well, been using it to transfer my work data every day between my work and my home for several months with no problem or data loss. The only thing is it is kinda small so i have to attached it to my keys. The hole at the end really useful for that matter
customer_reviews.author: kontol kuda

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLY THE BEST FLASH DRIVES YOU CAN BUY
customer_reviews.text: SIMPLY THE BEST FLASH DRIVES YOU CAN BUY. Comes in both silver and gold. Plug it in and it works. Integrated hole makes it perfect for an office of engineers and developers that all carry their flash drives differently: some on lanyards, some on keyrings, some on badge pulls...it just doesn't matter, they attach easily to everything. You can write on them with a Sharpie and wipe of the sharpie with an alcohol pad when you erase or change the data. I've been using these for 5 years and have literally bought hundreds for the office. Without a doubt my favorite and most asked for supply.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: 5 Year Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I had been using this for a little over 4 years when this thumb drive finally croaked. I went to Kingston's website and filled out for a warranty replacement. That process was incredibly easy. Now I have a brand new drive thanks to the 5 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Ehong A C.

customer_reviews.title: Kingston Digital DataTraveler Flash Drive is a Tough Little Cookie
customer_reviews.text: Over the past couple of years I've bought several batches of Kingston Digital DataTraveler Flash Drives (in both 8GB and 16GB configurations). They are tough, reliable, small, handy, and most of all, they share with me a great company name. Rodger Kingston
customer_reviews.author: Rodger Kingston

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the best USB drive on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many USB drives over the years, and the plastic ones inevitably break after being in my pocket or bag for a few months. Not this one though. It's the most rugged USB drive out there, and is perfectly sized. Easily fits on a keychain, and is just rock solid. Pretty sure you could run over this with a truck and it'd still work.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: cute, sexy and so  S L O W !
customer_reviews.text: I hate to give this such a low rating. However, despite the good looks (metal, very small, seems sturdy), the write speed is abysmally slow. I'm getting 2 or 3MB/s speed. It'll take all night to fill this drive. But then again, at an average 2 bucks each, I guess I shouldn't complain. This is probably best for sharing data with others, but not so much for doing a quick back up or file swap. 16GB will take you about an hour to write.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Compact USB
customer_reviews.text: Perfect compact USB drive. I love that it's super small and has no frills. Things I love about this -large memory -sleek design -very compact -stores files without problems -fits perfectly into the USB slot -never any problems with reading or saving files I have dropped this in the grass, and it took so long to find it because it was super small, so I suggest that you keep this attached to a keychain so it'll be easier to find if you drop it. I have many of these and will continue to purchase this USB whenever I need more.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: has its ups and downs
customer_reviews.text: i originally bought this to keep my system restore on which was fine, but i changed my mind and wanted to use it as an everyday stick, but its just so slow compared to USB 3. i ended up buying a USB 3 stick, and this one is currently sitting in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilfong

customer_reviews.title: Hard to believe how cheap these are
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. They're cheap enough to just give away and that's what I use them for sometimes. I have one on my keys so I always have a drive available to grab a couple of files. Capacity is well beyond what I need and these things are tough.
customer_reviews.author: mark hepburnTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Solid Metal Construction - Durable and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Kingston DataTraveler. Old one works fine, just upgraded to a larger size. I love these. I put them on my keychain, and anytime someone wants to share a file or if I need to quickly transfer a large file at work, it's always with me. Has come in handy many times and since it's on my keychain I never have to go looking for it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A.

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, great storage
customer_reviews.text: I've attached this to my keys and use it for storing my research data in my lab. Great storage capacity for large-scale files used at the lab. Pretty simple review, but I would definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a new USB. **I've had this flashdrive for at least two years, maybe more. Honestly forgot when I got it because I don't ever remember NOT having it on my key ring.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hyer

customer_reviews.title: This USB drive is probably my favorite one that I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This USB drive is probably my favorite one that I've ever used. Granted, it's not USB 3.0 like most are going to lately, however as far as USB 2.0 drives go this has to be the best one. The build quality alone makes a huge difference in your confidence and perception of the drive. This thing is solid, it's small, feels great. No cheap folding plastic or sliding plastic to break. I can't speak to the overall longevity of the drive since I've only owned it a year, however Kingston has yet to fail me over the years with RAM and other USB drives. Overall, a very solid, all-metal drive that simply feels better than its competition.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: They Always Work
customer_reviews.text: A great Flash Drive to have on your pack or whatever you use. Has always worked and has been through the travel test several times (From place to destination around globe) When I'm making documentaries in the middle of nowhere I always have a spare somewhere. Abrazos @vasconacho
customer_reviews.author: vasconacho

customer_reviews.title: Well it works just fine on my tv
customer_reviews.text: I have a tv that came with Roku installed. It said that if you put a usb stick in the usb port, it will allow you to pause and play back live tv. I read reviews saying it had to be a special usb stick, a really fast one. This was inexpensive and small, so I figured I'd give it a try. USB sticks are handy to have around anyway. Well it works just fine on my tv!
customer_reviews.author: Jmp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a USB drive that I could use to take to work. This Kingston Digital Traveler was very suitable for this. I can easily import my files from my home laptop with ease onto the the USB drive. I'm able to view my files without saving anything on my work computer. Very easy to use and it looks great! Its sleek, small and fits right on my key chain. I may get another one to keep all my wedding pictures on it. My only concern would be if I were to take it off my key chain I could see myself misplacing it or loosing it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two.

customer_reviews.title: It works but its slow......update 6/19/2015.....now its DEAD.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of space to use. Only cons its very slow. Prefer to use a 3.0 flash drive. (3 stars) Update: 6/19/2015 (1 star) Only used 11 GB of space and now its DEAD. I connect it in all my computers and don't recognized it. I lost all the data know. I have Lexar 4GB and Sandisk 8 & 16 GB more than 1 year and they are working. I had my Kingston Data Traveler with my car keys all the time. Never touch water of dust. So now I had a garbage flash memory with a lot of documents lost.
customer_reviews.author: GT1

customer_reviews.title: Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive works well and looks great on any keychain or just by itself. It holds 32 gigabytes, which is pretty good considering the low price. It is a modern and sleek product that works advertised. The only problem this seems to have is that it is fragile. After having it for about a week, it had a hard fall on the floor and didn't work after that. The seller immediately exchanged it for a new one which has held up much better, even after being dropped multiple times. Overall, I like this product and think it is a pretty good buy. I would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Tj35

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and value for the price. Not having a USB handy is almost unacceptable these days.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible quality in a stylish package. right now it's 32 gigs for $12, and I'm not sure you can find a better deal than that. I bought two of these and both have been going strong for about 2 years, despite one being on key chain and the other being left in a hot, moist climate. There are very minor scratches on the surface from being used so many times, but they're negligible and don't detract from the aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: MadMax

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep on a keychain with a small S-Biner
customer_reviews.text: This thing is rock solid and stays on my keychain (attached with a tiny Nite-Ize S-Biner). I don't care much about the speeds when it's really for keeping something handy all the time to transfer larger files from friends or to and from work. 64GB is a decent size and I have no problems grabbing large files while on the go. Overall, this is a great USB drive to keep on you at all times. Zero problems with pocket lint either (which has been a problem for me in the past).
customer_reviews.author: nobody

customer_reviews.title: Best USB stick I've found for keyring use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent storage sticks! I have purchased several of these Kingston DataTravelers now, from 16-to-64gb in size. They are very tough, work well on a keychain without being damaged at all, retain data as good as any Kingston memory product, and they are TINY! The whole body is the size of the silver end on a USB cable, so they fit in really tight places (like the end of a Raspberry Pi) perfectly. I use the 32 and 64 gb sticks to actually provide storage on my Raspberry quite frequently, as well as a 32gb I use as a 'portable briefcase' on my keyring. By far, the best USB stick I've found so far.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie C

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: My children live in other states. When they visit and we take so many photos, I needed something to send the photos to them without breaking the bank. I bought just one to test it out, and it worked perfectly for my need. My daughter got all the Christmas photos we took, and that was my purpose for buying it. I will buy a few more to keep on hand for our next photo shoot. And it's so tiny...amazing!
customer_reviews.author: philip

customer_reviews.title: 2 years of abuse before failure. Not bad... We will see how warranty holds up.
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years of this drive being on my keys, it stopped being recognized by some USB slots about 2 years in and 6 months ago, it very rarely is recognized when plugged in. Time for a new one. I will update the review once I attempt to warranty the item. Kingston says it's a 5 year warranty so let's see if they honor it. I am filing for an RMA today. I will update when I have more info. Hopefully I will be DataTraveling again soon.
customer_reviews.author: Rob T

customer_reviews.title: Nice size storage. Very reliable
customer_reviews.text: These USB sticks have worked great for me. At 8GB they hold a lot of data but not too much. I use mostly 8GB because all technology will probably fail at some point and 8GB is a good amount without overloading (or putting all your electronic eggs in one basket) I like the large hole. Easy to grab and also easy to tie a tag to . The price is also great. I own several of these. They are also inexpensive enough that if I had to share photos or a video or something I wouldn't be giving away a lot of $$ if I just gave someone the entire USB stick.
customer_reviews.author: Basil Rathbone

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I love these steel cased USB drive they are solid and take constant abuse on my keychain with a bunch of other keys going in and out of my pocket being thrown on the table for months with no issues. If it every breaks I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: S366

product_meta.title: Kingston Digital DataTraveler SE9 32GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive (DTSE9H/32GBZET)
product_meta.description: Size:32GB| style name:Frustration-Free PackagingKINGSTON DTSE9H/32GBZ Digital DataTraveler SE9 32GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive The 32GB DataTraveler SE9 USB Flash Drive from Kingston is a portable flash memory storage device equipped with a USB interface. It has a capless design, durable metal casing, and convenient ring for attachment to a key chain. The drive is compatible with Windows 8, 7, Vista and XP, as well as Mac OS X v10.6.x or later and Linux v2.6.x or later. Additionally, urDrive software is available for download, offering active storage that enables you to easily access and organize your files. Features 32GB Capacity USB Interface Capless Design Metal Casing with Attachment Ring
feature_bullets: Convenient small, capless, and pocket sized for easy transportability
Durable metal casing with sturdy ring
Supports Windows 7, Vista, XP and Mac

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars17,579 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
